results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Walter Batty, Mark McDonald, Bede Whiteman and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.

results.title: How to keep a job
results.brief_description: Discusses the habits and attitudes that make for job success once the job is obtained. A man seeking a new job after being fired at his last job is interviewed by the Personnel director of a company and is told that employers want men who are dependable, willing to work, co-operate, loyal and possess initiative.

results.title: The Story of Holmesglen Concrete Housing Project
results.creator_credit: Housing Commission of Victoria and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: The Housing Commission of Victoria has a huge project at Holmesglen, a suburb of Melbourne, for the manufacture of prefabricated houses. All components of a modern house or a block of flats are constructed at this factory and transported in bulk to the place of erection. Concrete walls, chimneys, fences, tiles for roofs, plumbing units, wooden door cupboards and other fittings are all shown under construction and are then shown being fitted into place as the house is erected. Credit is given to the research work being carried out by the CSIRO Building Research Division, particularly in regard to a new type of light weight concrete which has been developed there.

results.title: Holiday album
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Snapshots from a family holiday album show tourist attractions throughout Victoria: recreation in the metropolitan area; winter sports at Mt Buffalo; springtime in the Grampians; a leisurely journey down the Murray in the paddle-steamer “Coonawarra”; sailing and fishing at Lakes Entrance; forest country at Marysville; the beaches along the Great Ocean Road. Commentary by Robert Peach.

results.title: Hennessy's holiday
results.brief_description: The visit to Melbourne of Hennessy, a 180-pound St. Bernard dog. He sees the Botanical Gardens, the Sidney Myer Music Bowl, and the Shrine, and takes a run around the M.C.G. After intensive grooming he wins a prize at the Royal Melbourne Show, the takes a ride on the “Mightie Mouse” [sic], and he also enjoys a ride on Puffing Billy and a spin on the bay in a speedboat. A modelling appointment, having his portrait drawn by a cartoonist, and an appearance on ‘In Melbourne Tonight’ help make his visit a memorable one for all.

results.title: Grapes are growing
results.creator_credit: Peter Menzies, John Kingsford-Smith, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Australia’s wine industry. Shows the factors leading to high quality grapes; the process of wine making in which grapes are tested, weighed, transported, crushed, fermented, stored and bottled ready for use. Includes the traditional method of making ‘champagne’ and the importance of the Australian Wine Research Institute and Roseworthy College.

results.title: Gippsland Honeymoon
results.brief_description:
A honeymoon couple tour the Gippsland area and admire the scenic attractions of the country-side. Depicts many of Victoria’s famous tourist attractions including: Lakes Entrance, Gippsland, Orbost, the Snowy River, the Tambo River, Bairnsdale, Omeo, Walhalla Goldfields, Buchan Caves, Mallacoota Inlet, La Trobe Valley, Glen Maggie Weir and Ninety Mile Beach. Produced in conjunction with The Tourist Development Authority and The Gippsland Lakes and Tourist Promotion Council.

This film was discussed on ABC Gippsland Radio on 14 March 2020. The following are comments for viewers which add insight into the film

Martin Richardson “Joe” is Joe Southon, from Paynesville who wasn’t actually a Lakes Entrance fisherman, but was the chosen “talent” for the movie - it was through his connections that the film crew came down here to make the movie. He was a farmer, part-time fisherman, and farm manager whose property occupied a large part of what is now the town of Paynesville. He was also involved in many civic roles around the Bairnsdale Shire. His daughter Beryl and son Bluey still live in Paynesville.

Ashley Meek My father features on this add fishing at the Glenmaggie spillway

Neil Walters who picked up one of the narrators was Ross Higgins. “put the money on the fridge wog.!” (Kingswood Country)

Graeme Nixon Cape Conran my dad jim nixon boat and me. Front boat

results.title: Gateway to a city [West Gate Bridge]
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s West Gate Bridge is a gateway to the future - a future of unprecedented residential, commercial and industrial growth for Melbourne and its Western regions. This film of the opening ceremony gives a historical outlook to the development of the river, shipping and the effects on the growth of the city of Melbourne.

results.title: Early Melbourne mansions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Looks at three Melbourne mansions, Toorak House, Trewalla and Illawarra, including brief histories.
